class.name: LineFormat
class.description: Represents line and arrowhead formatting. For a line, the LineFormat object contains formatting information for the line itself; for a shape with a border, this object contains formatting information for the shape's border.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: Gets a ColorFormat object that represents the background color for a patterned line.

properties.name: beginArrowheadLength
properties.description: Specifies the length of the arrowhead at the beginning of the line.

properties.name: beginArrowheadStyle
properties.description: Specifies the style of the arrowhead at the beginning of the line.

properties.name: beginArrowheadWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the arrowhead at the beginning of the line.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: dashStyle
properties.description: Specifies the dash style for the line.

properties.name: endArrowheadLength
properties.description: Specifies the length of the arrowhead at the end of the line.

properties.name: endArrowheadStyle
properties.description: Specifies the style of the arrowhead at the end of the line.

properties.name: endArrowheadWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the arrowhead at the end of the line.

properties.name: foregroundColor
properties.description: Gets a ColorFormat object that represents the foreground color for the line.

properties.name: insetPen
properties.description: Specifies if to draw lines inside a shape.

properties.name: isVisible
properties.description: Specifies if the object, or the formatting applied to it, is visible.

properties.name: pattern
properties.description: Specifies the pattern applied to the line.

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: Specifies the degree of transparency of the line as a value between 0.0 (opaque) and 1.0 (clear).

properties.name: weight
properties.description: Specifies the thickness of the line in points.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify().

returns.description: Whereas the original Word.LineFormat object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.LineFormatData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked.
